issue.title: [CF 48] Show icon when spell on CD, but ignore GCD
issue.body:
ATTATCHING A SAVED VARIABLE FILE WILL GET YOUR TICKET ANSWERED 200 TIMES FASTER

SAVED VARIABLE FILES CAN BE FOUND IN "World of Warcraft/WTF/Account/<ACOOUNTNAME>/<REALMNAME>/<CHARNAME>/SavedVariables/TellMeWhen. lua"

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Set up an icon as a cooldown; I'm using the Paladin's 'Judgement' spell. Set it to show only when unusable. I also show a timer.
2. Use the spell. It should show the icon with the CD time remaining. Allow the CD to expire.
3. Use another spell which activates the global cooldown. The Judgement icon will show for the duration of the GCD.

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
I expect my Judgement icon to show only when Judgement is on cooldown. What I see is that the Judgement icon also shows when the global cooldown is active.

What version of the product are you using?
1.5.4

Do you have an error log of what happened?
It doesn't generate an error.

Please provide any additional information below.


> Posted by CurseForge user Furiant | Imported from CurseForge issue #48 | Raw

comments.body:
What level is this paladin?

Edited Nov 20, 2010

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

28, and she's always had this issue. Thank you for looking into this.

To be clear, I use TMW to track many other things on her than just Judgement. Crusader Strike, Consecration, Avenger's Shield, etc. I have these set up in 3 separate bars, and any invocation of the GCD will simultaneously light up all the cooldowns that I've set to show only when unuseable.

I also have an icon set to show when the Righteous Fury threat self-buff is missing. It does not light up on the GCD while the buff is active.

Hope this helps.

Edited Nov 20, 2010

> Posted by CurseForge user Furiant

That is why. When I released the first cata version way back when, a few of the GCD spells had been removed, so someone gave me new IDs and I never gave them a second thought. Turns out that the new spells had much higher level requirements. The spell for paladins that was being checked was cleanse, trained at level 34 or something. I changed this last minute in 2.0.1 when I saw this ticket, as well as the mage spell that was trained around this same level.

TL;DR: This is fixed in 2.0.1

Edited Nov 20, 2010
